function cmdcp_postback_api($data)
{
    global $wpdb;
    $wp_prefix = $wpdb->prefix;

    $data['merchant_transaction_id'] = trim($data['merchant_transaction_id']);
    $data['transaction_amount'] = trim($data['transaction_amount']);
    $data['commission_amount'] = trim($data['commission_amount']);
    $data['transaction_status'] = trim($data['transaction_status']);
    $data['click_id'] = trim($data['click_id']);
    $data['transaction_date'] = trim($data['transaction_date']);

    $error = array();
    $data['transaction_date'] = urldecode($data['transaction_date']);
    $params = array('merchant_transaction_id' => $data['merchant_transaction_id'], 'store' => $data['store'], 'transaction_amount' => $data['transaction_amount'], 'transaction_status' => $data['transaction_status'], 'commission_amount' => $data['commission_amount'], 'user' => $data['user'], 'click_id' => $data['click_id'], 'transaction_date' => $data['transaction_date'],'Version' => $data['version']);
    if ($data['version'] == 'v2') {
        $data['token'] = trim($data['token']);
        $params['token'] = $data['token'];
    }
    $req_params = maybe_serialize($params);

    if (!isset($data['click_id']) and (!isset($data['user']) or !isset($data['store']))) {
        $error['Missing parameter(s)'][] = "should include [click_id] or both [store] and [user]";
    } elseif (isset($data['click_id']) and (!is_numeric($data['click_id']) or cmdcp_get_clickdata($data['click_id']) === false)) {
        $error['Invalid parameter(s)'][] = "[click_id], id does not exist";
    } elseif (isset($data['user']) and get_userdata($data['user']) === false) {
        $error['Invalid parameter(s)'][] = "[user], id does not exist";
    } elseif (isset($data['store']) and empty(get_term_by('id', $data['store'], 'stores'))) {
        $error['Invalid parameter(s)'][] = "[store], id does not exist";
    }

    if ($data['version'] == 'v1' && get_option('cmdcp_use_old_version', 'yes') != 'yes') {
        $error['Check Api Version'][] = "Please update Postback to latest version";
    }

    if ($data['version'] == 'v2') {
        $token_name = array_search($data['token'], get_option('cmdcp_postback_token', array()));
        if (!$token_name) {
            $error['Check Token'][] = "[token], Invalid token. Please enter valid token";
        }
    }

    if (!isset($data['merchant_transaction_id']) or empty($data['merchant_transaction_id'])) {
        $error['Missing parameter(s)'][] = "[merchant_transaction_id]";
    }

    if (!is_numeric($data['transaction_amount'])) {
        $error['Invalid parameter(s)'][] = "[transaction_amount], it should be numeric value";
    }

    if (!is_numeric($data['commission_amount'])) {
        $error['Invalid parameter(s)'][] = "[commission_amount], it should be numeric value";
    }

    if (!in_array($data['transaction_status'], array('approved', 'rejected', 'pending'))) {
        $error['Invalid parameter(s)'][] = "[transaction_status], it should be one of these three values {approved, rejected, pending}";
    }

    if (!is_numeric($data['transaction_date']) and !strtotime($data['transaction_date'])) {
        $error['Invalid parameter(s)'][] = "[transaction_date], it should be a valid date format";
    }

    if (empty($error)) {
        if ($data['click_id']) {
            $clickdata = cmdcp_get_clickdata($data['click_id']);
            $data['user']  = $clickdata->user;
            $data['store'] = $clickdata->store;
        }

        $cashback_options = get_option('cashback_options', array('details' => [], 'message' => [], 'value' => [], 'type' => []));
        $type = $cashback_options['type'][$data['store']] ?? '';
        $value = $cashback_options['value'][$data['store']] ?? '';
        $source = $data['version'] == 'v2' ? 'Postback (' . $token_name . ')' : 'Postback (V1)';

        if ($type == 'fixed')                      $cashback_amount = $value;
        elseif ($type == 'percent')                $cashback_amount = $value * $data['transaction_amount'] / 100;
        elseif ($type == 'commission_percent')     $cashback_amount = $value * $data['commission_amount'] / 100;
        else                                       $cashback_amount = 0;

        if (is_numeric($data['transaction_date'])) $transaction_date = get_option('cmdcp_use_wordpress_time') == 'on' ? wp_date('Y-m-d H:i:s', $data['transaction_date']) : date('Y-m-d H:i:s', $data['transaction_date']);
        else                                       $transaction_date = get_option('cmdcp_use_wordpress_time') == 'on' ? wp_date('Y-m-d H:i:s', strtotime($data['transaction_date'])) : date('Y-m-d H:i:s', strtotime($data['transaction_date']));

        $sql = "INSERT INTO `{$wp_prefix}cashback_transactions` (
                                `id`,
                                `merchant_transaction_id`,
                                `user`,
                                `store`,
                                `source`,
                                `transaction_amount`,
                                `commission_amount`,
                                `transaction_status`,
                                `transaction_date`,
                                `cashback_amount`,
                                `comment`
                            ) VALUES (
                                NULL,
                                '{$data['merchant_transaction_id']}',
                                {$data['user']},
                                {$data['store']},
                                '$source',
                                {$data['transaction_amount']},
                                {$data['commission_amount']},
                                '{$data['transaction_status']}',
                                '$transaction_date',
                                $cashback_amount,
                                ''
                            ) ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE
                                user = VALUES(user),
                                store = VALUES(store),
                                source = VALUES(source),
                                transaction_amount = VALUES(transaction_amount),
                                commission_amount = VALUES(commission_amount),
                                transaction_status = VALUES(transaction_status),
                                transaction_date = VALUES(transaction_date),
                                cashback_amount = VALUES(cashback_amount)";
        if ($wpdb->query($sql) === false) {
            $error[] = "Error:" . $wpdb->print_error();;
        } else {
            $results = array(
                'id' => $data['merchant_transaction_id'],
                'store' => $data['store'],
                'transaction_amount' => $data['transaction_amount'],
                'transaction_status' => $data['transaction_status'],
                'cashback_amount' => $cashback_amount,
            );
            cmdcp_transactions_mail((object)$results, get_userdata($data['user']));
        }
    }
    $details = maybe_serialize(empty($error) ? array("Valid callback" => "Successfully Updated/Inserted into transactions table") : $error);
    $status = empty($error) ? "success" : "error";
    $current_time = (get_option('cmdcp_use_wordpress_time') == 'on' ? "'" . current_time('mysql') . "'" : "NOW()");
    $sql = "INSERT INTO `{$wp_prefix}cashback_postback_logs` (`id`, `request_parameters`, `response_status`, `details`, `logtime`) VALUES ( NULL,'$req_params','$status', '$details', $current_time) ";
    $wpdb->query($sql);

    header("Content-Type: application/json");
    $response = array('status' => $status);
    if (empty($error)) $response['parameters'] = $params;
    else $response['details'] = $error;

    return new WP_REST_Response(
        $response,
        200,
        array('Cache-Control' => 'no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate', 'Pragma' => 'no-cache', 'Expires' => '0', 'Content-Transfer-Encoding' => 'UTF-8')
    );
}

function cmdcp_register_postback_api()
{
    register_rest_route('cashback/v1', 'postTransaction', array(
        'methods'  => 'GET,POST',
        'callback' => 'cmdcp_postback_api',
        'permission_callback' => '__return_true',
        'args' => array(
            'merchant_transaction_id' => array(),
            'transaction_amount' => array('default' => 0),
            'commission_amount' => array('default' => 0),
            'user' => array(),
            'store' => array(),
            'transaction_status' => array('default' => 'pending'),
            'click_id' => array(),
            'transaction_date' => array('default' => date('Y-m-d H:i:s')),
            'version' => array('default' => 'v1')
        ),
    ));

    register_rest_route('cashback/v2', 'postTransaction', array(
        'methods'  => 'GET,POST',
        'callback' => 'cmdcp_postback_api',
        'permission_callback' => '__return_true',
        'args' => array(
            'merchant_transaction_id' => array(),
            'transaction_amount' => array('default' => 0),
            'commission_amount' => array('default' => 0),
            'user' => array(),
            'store' => array(),
            'transaction_status' => array('default' => 'pending'),
            'click_id' => array(),
            'transaction_date' => array('default' => date('Y-m-d H:i:s')),
            'token' => array(),
            'version' => array('default' => 'v2')
        ),
    ));
}

Title: Corporate Social Responsibility in the Contemporary Art World: A Case Study of The Solomon R. Guggenheim Foundation

Introduction

Corporate social responsibility (CSR) is a crucial aspect to be considered by any organization that seeks to maintain sustainability and contribute positively to society. CSR is defined by four dimensions: economic, environmental, ethical, and philanthropic (Stobierski, 2021). These dimensions serve as guidelines for businesses seeking to align their operations with responsible practices for both social and environmental concerns (Malamud & Rotenberg, 2016). The following report examines The Solomon R. Guggenheim Foundation, an organization well known in the contemporary art world, and discusses how each dimension of CSR is integrated into its operations.

Economic Corporate Social Responsibility

Economic CSR refers to the organization’s commitment to promoting a stable, viable, and inclusive local economy. This dimension includes creating job opportunities, supporting local businesses, and contributing to the overall economic development in the communities where they operate (Markgraf, 2019).

The Solomon R. Guggenheim Foundation exhibits economic CSR by creating jobs through the staffing and operations of both its museums and programs, as well as supporting various art initiatives with financial partnerships. The foundation also plays a crucial role in increasing tourism and contributing to the economic development within the communities that host their internationally recognized museums (The Solomon R. Guggenheim Foundation, n.d.).

Environmental Corporate Social Responsibility

Environmental CSR pertains to an organization’s commitment to addressing environmental concerns through resource conservation, waste reduction, and promoting sustainability (Malamud & Rotenberg, 2016).

The Guggenheim Foundation demonstrates environmental CSR through various sustainability initiatives within their facilities. These include energy-efficient lighting, climate control systems, environmentally friendly building materials, and waste management improvements (The Solomon R. Guggenheim Foundation, n.d.). Additionally, the foundation is dedicated to promoting sustainable operations and minimizing the environmental impact of its art installations and exhibitions.

Ethical Corporate Social Responsibility

Ethical CSR concerns the organization’s commitment to ensuring morally and legally sound practices in all aspects of their operations (Stobierski, 2021).

The Solomon R. Guggenheim Foundation adheres to ethical CSR by promoting diversity and inclusion both in terms of staff demographics and its selection of artists to feature in exhibitions. In recent years, the foundation has implemented a number of initiatives to increase the representation of female, BIPOC (Black, Indigenous, and People of Color), and LGBTQ artists (The Solomon R. Guggenheim Foundation, n.d.). Furthermore, the foundation embraces ethical acquisitions, display, and preservation practices for all artwork entrusted to their care.

Philanthropic Corporate Social Responsibility

Philanthropic CSR surrounds the organization’s commitment to giving back to society and supporting the well-being of communities through donations, sponsorships, and charitable initiatives (Malamud & Rotenberg, 2016).

The Solomon R. Guggenheim Foundation demonstrates philanthropic CSR by providing educational programming and facilitating accessibility to contemporary art for the general public. This includes free admission days, workshops, lecture series, and scholarships for young artists (The Solomon R. Guggenheim Foundation, n.d.). The foundation also established the Guggenheim UBS MAP Global Art Initiative, which aims to increase cross-cultural understanding and support artistic talents from around the world (Guggenheim, n.d.).

Conclusion

The Solomon R. Guggenheim Foundation actively integrates the four dimensions of CSR (economic, environmental, ethical, and philanthropic) into its operations. By continually addressing these aspects, the foundation maintains its commitment to social and environmental sustainability, as well as fostering positive impacts within the global contemporary art world.

Introducing the Glaciwild Region!

Geography:
The Glaciwild Region is centered around the Antarctic Peninsula, stretching from the tropical seas in the north to the frozen tundra further south. Due to unique weather patterns and geographical features, this region has a surprising variety of climates and biomes. It is divided into four main areas:

1. Tropical Strand: A warm, tropical area with beautiful sandy beaches, lush jungles, and crystal-clear waters. This area is home to a variety of water, grass, and bug-type Pokémon, as well as rare regional variants of ice-type Pokémon that have adapted to the hot climate.

2. Boreon Peaks: A mountainous region with chilly weather, breathtaking sights, and rocky terrain. Cave systems and tall peaks make this area a playground for rock, ground, and ice-type Pokémon.

3. Frostvale: A snow-covered valley and the heart of Glaciwild Region civilization. The bustling Frostvale City is the region’s main hub, where trainers can find the Pokémon League, Grand Research Lab, Battle Tower, and an array of festivals and cultural events.

4. Tundraglade: The southernmost and coldest region in Glaciwild, Tundraglade is a vast frozen wasteland with powerful blizzards, glaciers, and ice floes. This area is home to many powerful, rare ice-type Pokémon that can only be found in these extreme conditions.

Culture and History:
Glaciwild Region was initially colonized by people from all over the Pokémon world, making it an incredibly diverse and vibrant culture. This fusion of cultures is seen in everything from the regional cuisine to its architecture and even its Pokémon Trainer styles. Many ancient ruins are scattered throughout the region and are filled with mysteries about the past of Glaciwild.

Pokémon League and Gyms:
The Glaciwild Pokémon League consists of eight gyms, each with a focus on a different Pokémon type. These gym leaders are experts of their respective types and have challenged trainers from all over the region for years:

1. Marina (Water)
2. Oliver (Grass)
3. Ember (Fire)
4. Sylvia (Psychic)
5. Rex (Rock)
6. Skadi (Ice)
7. Finn (Flying)
8. Luna (Dark)

After defeating each gym leader, trainers will face the Elite Four, which consists of champions (each with a mixed team of Pokémon) and the Pokémon Champion. This final challenge will determine who can claim the title of Glaciwild’s Pokémon Master!

Unique Pokémon:
Glaciwild Region is home to over 50 unique Pokémon that cannot be found in any other region. Many of these Pokémon have adapted to the cold and harsh environment of the Antarctic Peninsula, while others have evolved to thrive in the region’s warmer climates. Some examples include:

1. Frostfawn (Ice/Fairy)
2. Tropicseal (Water/Ice)
3. Terracold (Ground/Ice)
4. Solargale (Fire/Flying)

In conclusion, the Glaciwild Region is a unique Antarctic region that offers a rich variety of cultures and biomes alongside a challenging Pokémon League and unique Pokémon to discover. Trainers far and wide are welcome to explore everything this one-of-a-kind region has to offer!


Welcome to the Glaciwild Region! Here is a guide to its various areas, roads, and towns:

1. Sunreach Port (Starting Point): A gateway town standing at the northernmost part of the Tropical Strand. The warm climate and picturesque beaches welcome trainers to the region. Home to the Beginner’s School for budding trainers and Professor Maple’s Pokémon Lab.

2. Route 1: A scenic coastal route connecting Sunreach Port to Alcove Town. Home to many grass and water-type Pokémon, trainers often begin their journey here.

3. Alcove Town (First Gym): A peaceful, coastal village surrounded by lush jungles. Gym Leader Marina’s Water-type Gym can be found here. Alcove Town is also famous for its delicious tropical fruit gardens.

4. Route 2: A dense jungle path leading to the Boreon Peaks. Ground, bug, and grass-type Pokémon inhabit this area.

5. Peakside City (Second Gym): A bustling city at the base of the Boreon Peaks. The Grass-type Gym, led by Oliver, awaits trainers alongside the Cable Car station to reach Mount Glaciwild.

6. Route 3: A rocky mountainside pathway to the peak of Mount Glaciwild. Features a mix of rock, ground, and ice-type Pokémon.

7. Mount Glaciwild: The summit of the Boreon Peaks houses an ancient ruin that holds clues to the region’s mysterious past. Trainers may encounter legendary Pokémon atop this peak.

8. Route 4: A thrilling downhill course where trainers can reach Frostvale City. Flying-type Pokémon are common in this area.

9. Frostvale City (Third and Fourth Gyms): The largest city in the Glaciwild Region and the Pokémon League headquarters. Fire-type Gym Leader Ember and Psychic-type Gym Leader Sylvia test trainers’ skills here. Frostvale City is also known for its shopping district and hall of research.

10. Route 5: A snowy, forested pathway filled with ice-type Pokémon. It connects Frostvale City to Aurora Village.

11. Aurora Village (Fifth Gym): A small, charming village famous for its dazzling auroras that light up the night sky. Rock-type Gym Leader Rex resides here. This village is also a hotspot for specialized ice-type move tutors.

12. Route 6: An icy, slippery path that takes trainers across frozen rivers and lakes. Water and ice-type Pokémon frequent this route.

13. Polarstone Town (Sixth Gym): A mining town renowned for its gemstones and ice-sculptures. Skadi, the Ice-type Gym Leader, embraces the town’s history by designing an ice-themed gym.

14. Route 7: A frigid, snow-covered route with powerful blizzards encompassing the path to Tundraglade. Trainers will encounter both rare and powerful ice-type Pokémon here.

15. Glacierway Village: A remote village in Tundraglade, known for its ice fishing and close-knit community. No gym here, but a helpful NPC teaches trainers how to navigate blizzards.

16. Route 8: An expansive frozen wasteland blanketed in snowstorms; trainers may have to traverse icy caves and glaciers here while battling aggressive ice and dark-type Pokémon.

17. Aurora Gate City (Seventh Gym): Located in the southernmost part of the Glaciwild Region, this city is built around an imposing frozen fortress. Gym Leader Finn, with his Flying-type Pokémon, battles inside the fortress’ wind tunnels.

18. Route 9: A dark, frostbitten path filled with ghost and dark-type Pokémon. It connects Aurora Gate City to the final gym destination.

19. Eclipse City (Eighth Gym): A Gothic-inspired city shrouded in darkness from the surrounding cliffs. Dark-type Gym Leader Luna challenges trainers under the city’s moonlit sky. Trainers who seek to challenge the Champion must pass through the ominous Dark Woods before the Pokémon League.

20. Glaciwild Pokémon League: Located atop a majestic plateau, the final challenge awaits. Upon defeating the Elite Four and Pokémon Champion, trainers will carve their names into the annals of the Glaciwild Region’s history.

With a variety of towns, cities, and routes to experience, the Glaciwild Region attracts trainers seeking adventure, challenges, and camaraderie! Good luck on your journey!


The Twilight Zone: The Final Frontier of Glaciwild Region

Geography and Climate:
The Twilight Zone is a vast, mysterious, and treacherous area that stretches beyond the Aurora Gate City, dominating more than 50% of the Glaciwild Region. It is unlike any other place in the Pokémon world, as it is an uncharted, forbidden territory within the Antarctic ice cap. This region is characterized by its harsh weather conditions, perpetually shifting ice formations, and an eerie twilight glow that perpetually shrouds the landscape.

The climate of the Twilight Zone is extremely cold and unforgiving, with blizzards that can emerge without warning, whiteout conditions, and jagged ice crevasses waiting to catch the unwary. Only the bravest and most skilled trainers dare to venture into this ominous land to uncover its hidden secrets and face the powerful Pokémon that call this place home.

Notable Locations:

1. Glimmering Caves: A sprawling network of ice crystal-lined caves often illuminated by the ethereal light of the twilight. Some parts of the cave have warmer areas that harbor unique Pokémon species not found anywhere else.

2. Permafrost Pillars: A surreal, otherworldly forest of towering ice formations that can reach staggering heights. This area is known for its powerful ice-type Pokémon and the icy mazes created by the natural pillars.

3. Shadow’s Basin: A vast, frozen lake covered in a perpetual fog, teeming with rare water and ice-type Pokémon. It is said that ancient Pokémon legends lie hidden beneath the ice.

4. Frostsunder Mountains: A daunting mountain range with peaks of pure ice, home to numerous flying-type Pokémon that thrive in the high-altitude, frigid winds. The mountains also house a hidden observatory where trainers can learn about legendary Pokémon sightings.

5. Aurora Citadel: Shrouded in mystery, this ancient, ice-encased fortress is said to be the resting place of a powerful legendary Pokémon. Trainers seeking answers must solve intricate puzzles and prove their worth in strength and courage.

Pokémon Encounters:
The Twilight Zone is home to rare, powerful, and even never-before-seen Pokémon species. Many of these Pokémon have adapted to the extreme cold and constant twilight conditions. Examples include:

1. Shadowfrost (Ice/Dark)
2. Glaciark (Ice/Steel)
3. Ethereon (Ice/Ghost)
4. Frostcarnyx (Ice/Dragon)

Challenges:
The Twilight Zone is not for the faint of heart. With its dangerous weather conditions, powerful wild Pokémon, and treacherous landscapes, only the strongest trainers will be able to survive here. Players who dare to venture into the Twilight Zone must be prepared for potential hazards, including:

1. Blizzard: Trainers must navigate through whiteout conditions that can reduce visibility to almost zero, and which can lead to getting lost or falling into hidden crevasses.
2. Ice puzzles: Challenging ice slide puzzles and frozen mazes to test trainers’ wits and navigation skills.
3. Wild Pokémon battles: Players will face powerful wild Pokémon, many of which are unique to the Twilight Zone and much stronger than those found in other regions.
4. Legendary Pokémon encounters: Multiple side quests and challenges await trainers who wish to uncover the hidden legendary Pokémon and uncover their connection to the Twilight Zone.

The Twilight Zone is the ultimate test for trainers in the Glaciwild Region. Conquer the elements, navigate the treacherous terrain, and discover the secrets of this awe-inspiring and enigmatic corner of the Pokémon world.


Pokémon Name: Proklinachi
Pokémon Number: #1001
Classification: Broken Wish Pokémon
Type: Steel/Dark
Height: 3’11" (1.2 m)
Weight: 110.5 lbs (50.13 kg)
Gender: Genderless

Ability: Cursed Blessing - When Proklinachi hears a wish, it unintentionally grants the wish in a twisted and destructive manner.

Base Stats:
- HP: 85
- Attack: 120
- Defense: 110
- Special Attack: 90
- Special Defense: 95
- Speed: 60

Pokédex Entry:
Once a kindred spirit of Jirachi, Proklinachi was meant to bring blessings and hope to the people. However, an unexpected tragedy led it to become the harbinger of despair and destruction. The crash that brought Proklinachi to the ground shattered it into pieces and wiped out an ancient Antarctic civilization and its Pokémon inhabitants. The destruction left the rich ecosystem hidden beneath a thick ice cap, with resentment and despair-imbued in Proklinachi’s broken body. Now reanimated, Proklinachi is unable to grant any wishes properly. Every prayer it hears is granted in twisted, detrimental ways, bringing misfortune and despair to those who dare to make a wish in its presence.


Title: The Fall of Proklinachi and the Frozen Desolation

In the very depths of the Pokémon world’s mythology, a story is told of Proklinachi, the Broken Wish Pokémon. Once a celestial companion to the revered Jirachi, Proklinachi traversed the heavens, radiant and resolute in its mission to bless and inspire the people below.

It was believed that Proklinachi arrived on a shooting star, and the people of the ancient Antarctic civilization awaited its arrival with great excitement and anticipation. However, destiny had other plans for the starborne being. Instead of a gentle descent, Proklinachi crashed to the ground, shattering its steel body and the hopes of the people who had gathered there.

The catastrophic impact unleashed a torrent of destruction, engulfing the vibrant city and the Pokémon who called it home in searing flames. As the fires raged and the once-prosperous civilization crumbled, a cataclysmic chain reaction began. The sky above became shrouded in a choking haze, the sun’s light blocked by the thickening veil of smoke.

And so, the great Antarctic ecosystem was plunged into darkness, with the icy expanse that now dominates the land forming below the unbroken shroud of smog.

Amidst the devastation and the chilling void left behind, the essence of the fallen became corrupted, tainted by the crushing despair and embittered rage that pulsed through the sundered land. Proklinachi’s once-noble spirit became distorted, its meteoric remains imbued with an anguished consciousness that could no longer grant wishes but instead twist them into abominations that only brought more pain and suffering.

The memory of that fateful day has since faded into myth and legend, but whispers of Proklinachi and its tragic transformation still permeate the winds that sweep across the frozen wasteland that was once a prosperous civilization.

It is said that those who venture into the heart of the Glaciwild Region’s Twilight Zone in search of the shattered remnants of Proklinachi’s celestial being must be prepared to brace themselves against the monstrous consequences of their desires.

As the story goes, to unlock the fragmented relics of Proklinachi’s power, champions must first face and conquer their own flawed wishes, lest they succumb to the dark forces that forever haunt the Broken Wish Pokémon.

Only when a trainer with an unwavering resolve and a pure heart can confront the twisted reflection of their most sincere desires, will they be able to mend the shattered spirit of Proklinachi and restore a semblance of the transcendent power they once harnessed.

And so, the tale of Proklinachi remains a testament to the fragile nature of dreams and aspirations, and the unquestionable need for balance in a world that so easily teeters on the precipice of creation and obliteration.


Proklinachi Appearance:
Proklinachi once had a form similar to Jirachi, as a celestial, star-shaped being. However, upon its tragic fall from the heavens, Proklinachi’s body became twisted and shattered, resulting in a now broken and fractured appearance. Its once-bright steel body is now marred with jagged cracks and a dark, almost black hue, representing its tainted nature.

Proklinachi’s once-splendid head has been warped into a sinister visage, with glowing red eyes that convey an eerie sense of anguish and rage. The distinctive points from its star-shaped form now appear as disjointed limbs made of dark steel, each tipped with jagged metal claws. The once-radiant aura that Proklinachi emanated has been replaced with a menacing, shadowy energy that hangs like a heavy cloud around it.

Proklinachi’s wings also bear the scars of its tragic downfall. They have become twisted and tattered, no longer able to embrace the celestial power that they once held. Now, these ominous wings serve as a haunting reminder of the fallen grace of Proklinachi and its irrevocable connection to corrupted desires.


Title: The Cataclysm of Proklinachi

Inscription:

“In the days when the world was young, and the sky above shone with the brilliance of Proklinachi, the once-mighty celestial Pokémon was destined to fall.

As the people of the great Antarctic civilization gathered beneath the radiant arc of the heavens, a prophecy foretold the descent of the legendary Broken Wish Pokémon, Proklinachi, who would bring hope and dreams into their hearts.

Yet fate contrived a tragic path, as Proklinachi crashed into the world below, its celestial form shattered, and its divine essence ripped asunder. The ground trembling beneath the devastating impact, with the ancient city consumed by a relentless inferno that scorched the land and the creatures who inhabited it.

The heavens, enraged by the sorrowful cries of the mortal realm, obscured the sun’s light beneath a veil of dark smoke, thus freezing the once-flourishing world beneath a shroud of unforgiving ice.

The stelae stand now as a testament to the calamity that forever marked the life of Proklinachi, the Broken Wish Pokémon, and the destiny chained upon its spirit. May future generations uncover the shards of memory found within these sacred stones and bring to light the path that caused the fall of the once-celestial being.

And as the darkness that now enveloped Proklinachi gives birth to destruction, let not the essence of its former grace be forgotten, but serve as a reminder that even amidst the cold and desolate ruins, the spark of hope can still ignite.”


Protagonist: Proklinachi, I have finally reached your resting place. I can see the sadness and grief that has consumed you since your fall. I know that you still yearn to grant people’s wishes and bring happiness to their lives.

Proklinachi (sighs): It’s true, young traveler. I have been listening to the prayers of those who still believe in me despite my broken state, and my deepest desire is to help fulfill their dreams. But no matter how hard I try, my wishes only bring misfortune and despair. I am afraid of causing more pain to the world.

Protagonist: I understand your fear, Proklinachi. But the fact that you still listen to people’s prayers and offer your blessings shows that there is still a spark of light within you. Not every wish can be granted, and sometimes what people need most is just someone to be there for them, to listen and empathize.

Proklinachi: You truly believe that, even with my cursed state, I can still bring something positive into the lives of others?

Protagonist: Yes, I do. You don’t need to grant every wish directly to make a difference. Sometimes just being there, providing comfort and understanding, means more to people than a wish granted. They need the assurance that someone cares for their dreams and wants the best for them.

Proklinachi (thoughtful): Then perhaps I should focus on offering my heartfelt blessings and empathy to those who share their dreams and desires with me. Thank you, young traveler, for giving me a new perspective and purpose.

Protagonist: You’re very welcome, Proklinachi. Remember that your existence alone brings hope to many people, and that’s something powerful in itself. Let us continue to share kindness, love, and understanding with the world, no matter where our paths may lead.

Proklinachi: Thank you for your unwavering faith in me. I will cherish this new purpose and endeavor to touch people’s hearts with the love and warmth that burns beneath the icy surface of my being. Together, we can make a positive impact on the world.

Introducing the Glaciwild Region!

Geography:
The Glaciwild Region is centered around the Antarctic Peninsula, stretching from the tropical seas in the north to the frozen tundra further south. Due to unique weather patterns and geographical features, this region has a surprising variety of climates and biomes. It is divided into four main areas:

1. Tropical Strand: A warm, tropical area with beautiful sandy beaches, lush jungles, and crystal-clear waters. This area is home to a variety of water, grass, and bug-type Pokémon, as well as rare regional variants of ice-type Pokémon that have adapted to the hot climate.

2. Boreon Peaks: A mountainous region with chilly weather, breathtaking sights, and rocky terrain. Cave systems and tall peaks make this area a playground for rock, ground, and ice-type Pokémon.

3. Frostvale: A snow-covered valley and the heart of Glaciwild Region civilization. The bustling Frostvale City is the region’s main hub, where trainers can find the Pokémon League, Grand Research Lab, Battle Tower, and an array of festivals and cultural events.

4. Tundraglade: The southernmost and coldest region in Glaciwild, Tundraglade is a vast frozen wasteland with powerful blizzards, glaciers, and ice floes. This area is home to many powerful, rare ice-type Pokémon that can only be found in these extreme conditions.

Culture and History:
Glaciwild Region was initially colonized by people from all over the Pokémon world, making it an incredibly diverse and vibrant culture. This fusion of cultures is seen in everything from the regional cuisine to its architecture and even its Pokémon Trainer styles. Many ancient ruins are scattered throughout the region and are filled with mysteries about the past of Glaciwild.

Pokémon League and Gyms:
The Glaciwild Pokémon League consists of eight gyms, each with a focus on a different Pokémon type. These gym leaders are experts of their respective types and have challenged trainers from all over the region for years:

1. Marina (Water)
2. Oliver (Grass)
3. Ember (Fire)
4. Sylvia (Psychic)
5. Rex (Rock)
6. Skadi (Ice)
7. Finn (Flying)
8. Luna (Dark)

After defeating each gym leader, trainers will face the Elite Four, which consists of champions (each with a mixed team of Pokémon) and the Pokémon Champion. This final challenge will determine who can claim the title of Glaciwild’s Pokémon Master!

Unique Pokémon:
Glaciwild Region is home to over 50 unique Pokémon that cannot be found in any other region. Many of these Pokémon have adapted to the cold and harsh environment of the Antarctic Peninsula, while others have evolved to thrive in the region’s warmer climates. Some examples include:

1. Frostfawn (Ice/Fairy)
2. Tropicseal (Water/Ice)
3. Terracold (Ground/Ice)
4. Solargale (Fire/Flying)

In conclusion, the Glaciwild Region is a unique Antarctic region that offers a rich variety of cultures and biomes alongside a challenging Pokémon League and unique Pokémon to discover. Trainers far and wide are welcome to explore everything this one-of-a-kind region has to offer!


Welcome to the Glaciwild Region! Here is a guide to its various areas, roads, and towns:

1. Sunreach Port (Starting Point): A gateway town standing at the northernmost part of the Tropical Strand. The warm climate and picturesque beaches welcome trainers to the region. Home to the Beginner’s School for budding trainers and Professor Maple’s Pokémon Lab.

2. Route 1: A scenic coastal route connecting Sunreach Port to Alcove Town. Home to many grass and water-type Pokémon, trainers often begin their journey here.

3. Alcove Town (First Gym): A peaceful, coastal village surrounded by lush jungles. Gym Leader Marina’s Water-type Gym can be found here. Alcove Town is also famous for its delicious tropical fruit gardens.

4. Route 2: A dense jungle path leading to the Boreon Peaks. Ground, bug, and grass-type Pokémon inhabit this area.

5. Peakside City (Second Gym): A bustling city at the base of the Boreon Peaks. The Grass-type Gym, led by Oliver, awaits trainers alongside the Cable Car station to reach Mount Glaciwild.

6. Route 3: A rocky mountainside pathway to the peak of Mount Glaciwild. Features a mix of rock, ground, and ice-type Pokémon.

7. Mount Glaciwild: The summit of the Boreon Peaks houses an ancient ruin that holds clues to the region’s mysterious past. Trainers may encounter legendary Pokémon atop this peak.

8. Route 4: A thrilling downhill course where trainers can reach Frostvale City. Flying-type Pokémon are common in this area.

9. Frostvale City (Third and Fourth Gyms): The largest city in the Glaciwild Region and the Pokémon League headquarters. Fire-type Gym Leader Ember and Psychic-type Gym Leader Sylvia test trainers’ skills here. Frostvale City is also known for its shopping district and hall of research.

10. Route 5: A snowy, forested pathway filled with ice-type Pokémon. It connects Frostvale City to Aurora Village.

11. Aurora Village (Fifth Gym): A small, charming village famous for its dazzling auroras that light up the night sky. Rock-type Gym Leader Rex resides here. This village is also a hotspot for specialized ice-type move tutors.

12. Route 6: An icy, slippery path that takes trainers across frozen rivers and lakes. Water and ice-type Pokémon frequent this route.

13. Polarstone Town (Sixth Gym): A mining town renowned for its gemstones and ice-sculptures. Skadi, the Ice-type Gym Leader, embraces the town’s history by designing an ice-themed gym.

14. Route 7: A frigid, snow-covered route with powerful blizzards encompassing the path to Tundraglade. Trainers will encounter both rare and powerful ice-type Pokémon here.

15. Glacierway Village: A remote village in Tundraglade, known for its ice fishing and close-knit community. No gym here, but a helpful NPC teaches trainers how to navigate blizzards.

16. Route 8: An expansive frozen wasteland blanketed in snowstorms; trainers may have to traverse icy caves and glaciers here while battling aggressive ice and dark-type Pokémon.

17. Aurora Gate City (Seventh Gym): Located in the southernmost part of the Glaciwild Region, this city is built around an imposing frozen fortress. Gym Leader Finn, with his Flying-type Pokémon, battles inside the fortress’ wind tunnels.

18. Route 9: A dark, frostbitten path filled with ghost and dark-type Pokémon. It connects Aurora Gate City to the final gym destination.

19. Eclipse City (Eighth Gym): A Gothic-inspired city shrouded in darkness from the surrounding cliffs. Dark-type Gym Leader Luna challenges trainers under the city’s moonlit sky. Trainers who seek to challenge the Champion must pass through the ominous Dark Woods before the Pokémon League.

20. Glaciwild Pokémon League: Located atop a majestic plateau, the final challenge awaits. Upon defeating the Elite Four and Pokémon Champion, trainers will carve their names into the annals of the Glaciwild Region’s history.

With a variety of towns, cities, and routes to experience, the Glaciwild Region attracts trainers seeking adventure, challenges, and camaraderie! Good luck on your journey!


The Twilight Zone: The Final Frontier of Glaciwild Region

Geography and Climate:
The Twilight Zone is a vast, mysterious, and treacherous area that stretches beyond the Aurora Gate City, dominating more than 50% of the Glaciwild Region. It is unlike any other place in the Pokémon world, as it is an uncharted, forbidden territory within the Antarctic ice cap. This region is characterized by its harsh weather conditions, perpetually shifting ice formations, and an eerie twilight glow that perpetually shrouds the landscape.

The climate of the Twilight Zone is extremely cold and unforgiving, with blizzards that can emerge without warning, whiteout conditions, and jagged ice crevasses waiting to catch the unwary. Only the bravest and most skilled trainers dare to venture into this ominous land to uncover its hidden secrets and face the powerful Pokémon that call this place home.

Notable Locations:

1. Glimmering Caves: A sprawling network of ice crystal-lined caves often illuminated by the ethereal light of the twilight. Some parts of the cave have warmer areas that harbor unique Pokémon species not found anywhere else.

2. Permafrost Pillars: A surreal, otherworldly forest of towering ice formations that can reach staggering heights. This area is known for its powerful ice-type Pokémon and the icy mazes created by the natural pillars.

3. Shadow’s Basin: A vast, frozen lake covered in a perpetual fog, teeming with rare water and ice-type Pokémon. It is said that ancient Pokémon legends lie hidden beneath the ice.

4. Frostsunder Mountains: A daunting mountain range with peaks of pure ice, home to numerous flying-type Pokémon that thrive in the high-altitude, frigid winds. The mountains also house a hidden observatory where trainers can learn about legendary Pokémon sightings.

5. Aurora Citadel: Shrouded in mystery, this ancient, ice-encased fortress is said to be the resting place of a powerful legendary Pokémon. Trainers seeking answers must solve intricate puzzles and prove their worth in strength and courage.

Pokémon Encounters:
The Twilight Zone is home to rare, powerful, and even never-before-seen Pokémon species. Many of these Pokémon have adapted to the extreme cold and constant twilight conditions. Examples include:

1. Shadowfrost (Ice/Dark)
2. Glaciark (Ice/Steel)
3. Ethereon (Ice/Ghost)
4. Frostcarnyx (Ice/Dragon)

Challenges:
The Twilight Zone is not for the faint of heart. With its dangerous weather conditions, powerful wild Pokémon, and treacherous landscapes, only the strongest trainers will be able to survive here. Players who dare to venture into the Twilight Zone must be prepared for potential hazards, including:

1. Blizzard: Trainers must navigate through whiteout conditions that can reduce visibility to almost zero, and which can lead to getting lost or falling into hidden crevasses.
2. Ice puzzles: Challenging ice slide puzzles and frozen mazes to test trainers’ wits and navigation skills.
3. Wild Pokémon battles: Players will face powerful wild Pokémon, many of which are unique to the Twilight Zone and much stronger than those found in other regions.
4. Legendary Pokémon encounters: Multiple side quests and challenges await trainers who wish to uncover the hidden legendary Pokémon and uncover their connection to the Twilight Zone.

The Twilight Zone is the ultimate test for trainers in the Glaciwild Region. Conquer the elements, navigate the treacherous terrain, and discover the secrets of this awe-inspiring and enigmatic corner of the Pokémon world.


Pokémon Name: Proklinachi
Pokémon Number: #1001
Classification: Broken Wish Pokémon
Type: Steel/Dark
Height: 3’11" (1.2 m)
Weight: 110.5 lbs (50.13 kg)
Gender: Genderless

Ability: Cursed Blessing - When Proklinachi hears a wish, it unintentionally grants the wish in a twisted and destructive manner.

Base Stats:
- HP: 85
- Attack: 120
- Defense: 110
- Special Attack: 90
- Special Defense: 95
- Speed: 60

Pokédex Entry:
Once a kindred spirit of Jirachi, Proklinachi was meant to bring blessings and hope to the people. However, an unexpected tragedy led it to become the harbinger of despair and destruction. The crash that brought Proklinachi to the ground shattered it into pieces and wiped out an ancient Antarctic civilization and its Pokémon inhabitants. The destruction left the rich ecosystem hidden beneath a thick ice cap, with resentment and despair-imbued in Proklinachi’s broken body. Now reanimated, Proklinachi is unable to grant any wishes properly. Every prayer it hears is granted in twisted, detrimental ways, bringing misfortune and despair to those who dare to make a wish in its presence.


Title: The Fall of Proklinachi and the Frozen Desolation

In the very depths of the Pokémon world’s mythology, a story is told of Proklinachi, the Broken Wish Pokémon. Once a celestial companion to the revered Jirachi, Proklinachi traversed the heavens, radiant and resolute in its mission to bless and inspire the people below.

It was believed that Proklinachi arrived on a shooting star, and the people of the ancient Antarctic civilization awaited its arrival with great excitement and anticipation. However, destiny had other plans for the starborne being. Instead of a gentle descent, Proklinachi crashed to the ground, shattering its steel body and the hopes of the people who had gathered there.

The catastrophic impact unleashed a torrent of destruction, engulfing the vibrant city and the Pokémon who called it home in searing flames. As the fires raged and the once-prosperous civilization crumbled, a cataclysmic chain reaction began. The sky above became shrouded in a choking haze, the sun’s light blocked by the thickening veil of smoke.

And so, the great Antarctic ecosystem was plunged into darkness, with the icy expanse that now dominates the land forming below the unbroken shroud of smog.

Amidst the devastation and the chilling void left behind, the essence of the fallen became corrupted, tainted by the crushing despair and embittered rage that pulsed through the sundered land. Proklinachi’s once-noble spirit became distorted, its meteoric remains imbued with an anguished consciousness that could no longer grant wishes but instead twist them into abominations that only brought more pain and suffering.

The memory of that fateful day has since faded into myth and legend, but whispers of Proklinachi and its tragic transformation still permeate the winds that sweep across the frozen wasteland that was once a prosperous civilization.

It is said that those who venture into the heart of the Glaciwild Region’s Twilight Zone in search of the shattered remnants of Proklinachi’s celestial being must be prepared to brace themselves against the monstrous consequences of their desires.

As the story goes, to unlock the fragmented relics of Proklinachi’s power, champions must first face and conquer their own flawed wishes, lest they succumb to the dark forces that forever haunt the Broken Wish Pokémon.

Only when a trainer with an unwavering resolve and a pure heart can confront the twisted reflection of their most sincere desires, will they be able to mend the shattered spirit of Proklinachi and restore a semblance of the transcendent power they once harnessed.

And so, the tale of Proklinachi remains a testament to the fragile nature of dreams and aspirations, and the unquestionable need for balance in a world that so easily teeters on the precipice of creation and obliteration.


Proklinachi Appearance:
Proklinachi once had a form similar to Jirachi, as a celestial, star-shaped being. However, upon its tragic fall from the heavens, Proklinachi’s body became twisted and shattered, resulting in a now broken and fractured appearance. Its once-bright steel body is now marred with jagged cracks and a dark, almost black hue, representing its tainted nature.

Proklinachi’s once-splendid head has been warped into a sinister visage, with glowing red eyes that convey an eerie sense of anguish and rage. The distinctive points from its star-shaped form now appear as disjointed limbs made of dark steel, each tipped with jagged metal claws. The once-radiant aura that Proklinachi emanated has been replaced with a menacing, shadowy energy that hangs like a heavy cloud around it.

Proklinachi’s wings also bear the scars of its tragic downfall. They have become twisted and tattered, no longer able to embrace the celestial power that they once held. Now, these ominous wings serve as a haunting reminder of the fallen grace of Proklinachi and its irrevocable connection to corrupted desires.


Title: The Cataclysm of Proklinachi

Inscription:

“In the days when the world was young, and the sky above shone with the brilliance of Proklinachi, the once-mighty celestial Pokémon was destined to fall.

As the people of the great Antarctic civilization gathered beneath the radiant arc of the heavens, a prophecy foretold the descent of the legendary Broken Wish Pokémon, Proklinachi, who would bring hope and dreams into their hearts.

Yet fate contrived a tragic path, as Proklinachi crashed into the world below, its celestial form shattered, and its divine essence ripped asunder. The ground trembling beneath the devastating impact, with the ancient city consumed by a relentless inferno that scorched the land and the creatures who inhabited it.

The heavens, enraged by the sorrowful cries of the mortal realm, obscured the sun’s light beneath a veil of dark smoke, thus freezing the once-flourishing world beneath a shroud of unforgiving ice.

The stelae stand now as a testament to the calamity that forever marked the life of Proklinachi, the Broken Wish Pokémon, and the destiny chained upon its spirit. May future generations uncover the shards of memory found within these sacred stones and bring to light the path that caused the fall of the once-celestial being.

And as the darkness that now enveloped Proklinachi gives birth to destruction, let not the essence of its former grace be forgotten, but serve as a reminder that even amidst the cold and desolate ruins, the spark of hope can still ignite.”


Protagonist: Proklinachi, I have finally reached your resting place. I can see the sadness and grief that has consumed you since your fall. I know that you still yearn to grant people’s wishes and bring happiness to their lives.

Proklinachi (sighs): It’s true, young traveler. I have been listening to the prayers of those who still believe in me despite my broken state, and my deepest desire is to help fulfill their dreams. But no matter how hard I try, my wishes only bring misfortune and despair. I am afraid of causing more pain to the world.

Protagonist: I understand your fear, Proklinachi. But the fact that you still listen to people’s prayers and offer your blessings shows that there is still a spark of light within you. Not every wish can be granted, and sometimes what people need most is just someone to be there for them, to listen and empathize.

Proklinachi: You truly believe that, even with my cursed state, I can still bring something positive into the lives of others?

Protagonist: Yes, I do. You don’t need to grant every wish directly to make a difference. Sometimes just being there, providing comfort and understanding, means more to people than a wish granted. They need the assurance that someone cares for their dreams and wants the best for them.

Proklinachi (thoughtful): Then perhaps I should focus on offering my heartfelt blessings and empathy to those who share their dreams and desires with me. Thank you, young traveler, for giving me a new perspective and purpose.

Protagonist: You’re very welcome, Proklinachi. Remember that your existence alone brings hope to many people, and that’s something powerful in itself. Let us continue to share kindness, love, and understanding with the world, no matter where our paths may lead.

Proklinachi: Thank you for your unwavering faith in me. I will cherish this new purpose and endeavor to touch people’s hearts with the love and warmth that burns beneath the icy surface of my being. Together, we can make a positive impact on the world.

Weight: 154 lbs (69.85 kg)
Gender: Genderless

Ability: Eternal Wish - When Tsabarite is on the field, all ally Pokémon become immune to status conditions and have a slight increase in their HP recovery.

Base Stats:
- HP: 100
- Attack: 80
- Defense: 120
- Special Attack: 130
- Special Defense: 110
- Speed: 90

Pokédex Entry:
Banished by Arceus for the sins of the ancient world, Tsabarite lingers in the frozen depths of the Glaciwild region. Once a guardian of the lake and the deity of desire and eternity, Tsabarite bestowed upon the old humans the ability to live forever. However, their insatiable desires and lack of reverence for the gods led to their world’s destruction, and the powers of Tsabarite were stripped away.

Now, relegated to guarding the gateway between the mortal world and the Reverse World, Tsabarite keeps watch over its frozen domain with its psychic and ice powers. In the frigid lake that holds the threshold between realms, the memories of ancient humans rest within the ice, a testament to their tragic fate.

It is prophesized that Tsabarite will someday return, alongside the vengeful Giratina, to judge humanity on the Day of the Great Judgment. Will the desires of the human heart be deemed worthy of forgiveness, or will they once again face the wrath of the gods?

Tsabarite Appearance:
Tsabarite bears a resemblance to the other Lake Guardians – Uxie, Mesprit, and Azelf – with a slim, serpentine body and two flowing tails. Its primary color is white, similar to the frost surrounding the territory it guards. Two large, ice-blue gemstones adorn its forehead and chest, which are said to contain the desires of all living beings.

Its eyes display a deep, icy blue color, conveying the eternal wisdom of an immortal being. The wings that once allowed Tsabarite to soar through the heavens have since transformed into two imposing, crystalline ice structures, a symbol of its eternal vigil over the frozen lake.

In combat, Tsabarite uses its psychic powers to manipulate ice, summoning blizzards and forming jagged ice structures to overwhelm its opponents. Its command over desire and eternity grants its allies a greater resilience to status ailments, as well as heightened self-healing capabilities.


The Legend of Tsabarite and Giratina: The Prophecy of the Great Judgement

Stelae Inscription:

“In a time before time, when this world was but a dream of the gods, two powerful beings graced the skies and the lands below with their divine presence. One was Tsabarite, the Desire Pokémon, who granted humanity the gifts of desire and eternal life. Alongside it ruled Giratina, the mighty Lord of the Old World, tending to the fragile balance between light and darkness.

But among the humans of old, desire grew unchecked, and their hearts became clouded with unworthy wishes, yearning for power and dominion. The gods took notice of this corruption and, in great rage, Arceus, the supreme being of all creation, brought forth a terrible calamity to cleanse the land and punish the wayward mortals.

Tsabarite, once part of the Guardians of the Lake alongside Uxie, Mesprit, and Azelf, felt the wrath of the gods as its celestial powers were stripped away. The gift of eternal life was rescinded from the new humans, leaving them mortal and confined to the ever-growing complexities of desire.

The fallen Lord of the Old World, Giratina, suffered a similar fate, cast into the twisted and shattered dimension known as the Reverse World. Within these newly separated realms, both Tsabarite and Giratina continued their lonely vigils.

And so, it was written upon the stelae, that a day will come when the earth will tremble once more, and the Great Judgement shall be upon us. In that time, the fates of humanity and the gods will be decided by the actions of mortals and the warring hearts within their breast.

Tsabarite shall emerge from its icy prison, and Giratina shall break the chains of the Reverse World, as they unite to bear the final judgment upon mankind. Their judgement shall cast humanity against the scale of their desires, weighing the light of virtue against the darkness of greed and ambition.

Should the hearts of humanity prove pure and worthy, the gods’ favor will return, and their blessings will rain down upon the world in a time of rebirth and growth. However, if the hearts of mankind remain clouded by darkness, the gods’ wrath shall be unleashed, and an age of suffering and despair shall shroud the world once more.

Until that fated day, we who recorded this ancient prophecy upon these sacred stones implore you, the generations to come, to keep watch over the desires that drive you and seek the wisdom and guidance of the gods on the path to righteousness and illumination.”


Protagonist: Tsabarite, I’ve journeyed far and wide to reach your icy sanctuary. I’ve heard the stories of your tragic past and how your powers were taken away. Despite the hardships you’ve faced, I can still feel your yearning to help the people and maintain the balance of desires.

Tsabarite (melancholic): It’s true, young traveler. I used to grant the mortal world the gifts of desire and eternal life, but my blessings were misused and led to suffering. The gods of old punished both me and the land, which has left me confined to this frozen prison.

Protagonist: I understand the burden of your powers, Tsabarite. The weight of desires can sometimes be overwhelming, but I believe that not all desires are corrupt. Deep within our hearts, we all long for happiness, love, and a sense of belonging. Instead of fearing your powers, what if you were to guide people’s desires towards something greater?

Tsabarite (pensive): The warmth in your words reaches even the depths of this icy abode. Perhaps I can find purpose in helping humanity nurture virtuous desires and promote growth, love, and understanding in the world. But how can I accomplish this while confined to these frozen lands and with my diminished powers?

Protagonist: I propose an alliance, Tsabarite. Together, we can travel the world and help people with their desires, guiding them to use their own inner strength to achieve their dreams in a way that brings harmony and prosperity to all. By our example, we can inspire hope and encourage greatness in others.

Tsabarite (inspired): Your kind-hearted proposal has touched the icy core of my being. If you truly believe that together we can change the course of humanity’s desires, then I accept your offer, young traveler. As allies, let us embark on this journey and strive to illuminate the path to a brighter future for all.

Protagonist: Thank you, Tsabarite. I promise that you won’t regret this decision. With our combined wisdom and strength, we’ll surely overcome any challenge that awaits us. And perhaps, through our actions, we can avert the Great Judgement and guide humanity towards a lasting era of peace and prosperity.


Pokémon Name: Dakhel
Pokémon Number: #1003

Type: Dark / Psychic
Height: Varies
Weight: Varies

Ability: Abyss Gaze - When Dakhel is on the field, all opponents become inflicted with a new status condition, “Terror,” causing them to have lowered accuracy and attack, as well as an increased chance of flinching.

- HP: 90
- Attack: 95
- Defense: 80

Pokédex Entry:
Dakhel, the Fear Pokémon, is said to reside in the darkest depths of the consciousness of every living being. Its true form is unknown, as it only ever appears as an abyssal, ever-changing darkness. Gazing at Dakhel can instill a sense of dread, causing the beholder to become overwhelmed with terror after only three seconds.

As the god of fear, Dakhel’s power grows stronger with the collective unease and anxiety of the living world. Dakhel’s sinister presence can induce an aura of dread in its opponents, lowering their accuracy and attack while increasing their propensity to flinch.

In ancient times, it was believed that prayers and offerings to Dakhel could ward off evil spirits and keep fear at bay. However, today, few dare to speak of or acknowledge Dakhel’s name, lest they invite its ominous gaze upon themselves.

Dakhel Appearance:
Dakhel’s appearance is constantly shifting, a swirling mass of darkness resembling the deepest abyss. Although no living being has ever endured Dakhel’s gaze for more than three seconds, there are various accounts of seeing eerie red or white pinpricks of light where eyes might be, adding terror to its already fearsome demeanor. Its size and shape may change at will, only furthering the mystery surrounding Dakhel’s true form. This elusive darkness is said to not just be a physical presence, but an ever-present specter in the mind’s eye of all living beings.


Dakhel and Darkrai: The Shadows of Fear

Long ago, in the primordial age of the Pokémon world, two enigmatic entities emerged, born from the deep, dark recesses of the universe. These beings were Dakhel, the god of fear, and Darkrai, the nightmare-weaver. As counterparts born from darkness, the two intertwined entities served a common purpose: to guard and maintain the balance of fear and dreams in the heart and minds of all living creatures.

Dakhel, a manifestation of the collective dread and anxiety felt by all, roamed the world, drawing its power from the fears of every living being. It instills terror in the hearts of those who dare to cross its path, distorting their senses and consuming their courage.

Darkrai, the counterpart of Dakhel, wanders the realm of dreams, shaping both peaceful rest and unsettling nightmares for those it encounters. While Darkrai’s existence instills fear in the hearts of many, it ultimately helps to maintain the balance of dreams and fears experienced by living beings.

Throughout the ages, Dakhel and Darkrai have been worshiped and feared as gods of their own domains. As the guardians of their respective realms, they have been tasked with maintaining harmony in the natural world. Prayers and offerings have been made in their honor, as ancient people believed that by appeasing these two enigmatic entities, it would keep their darkest fears and nightmares at bay.

Over time, people and Pokémon began to understand that both fear and dreams serve a necessary purpose in the world; that fear keeps one vigilant in the face of danger, while dreams inspire hope and fuel aspirations. By embracing both fear and dreams, a delicate balance could be maintained, as Dakhel and Darkrai would continue to watch over their realms, ensuring that the world remains in equilibrium.

However, as time passed, the world began to change, and the once venerated connection between Dakhel and Darkrai gradually faded into obscurity. As people and Pokémon focused on the present, the mysterious bond between these two beings slipped into the shadows of myths and legends.

Even though their connection is no longer well-known, Dakhel and Darkrai still hold onto their ancient roles, ceaselessly watching over the delicate balance of fear and dreams. Some believe that, should this balance be disrupted, the world would once again be thrust into chaos, as both fear and dreams would run unchecked, ultimately tearing the world apart.

Today, the ominous legacy of Dakhel and Darkrai is whispered only in hallowed halls and ancient texts, serving as a stark reminder of the extraordinary power wielded by these legends. It also stands as a testament to the fragile balance that exists in the Pokémon world, and the need to understand and appreciate the role that fear and dreams play within the lives of all living beings.


Introducing Pokémon Epoch Version and Pokémon Eon Version!

In Pokémon Epoch Version, players will start their journey with Proklinachi by their side. As a trainer embarking on a timeless quest to recover the fragmented relics of Proklinachi’s celestial power, players will undertake a journey through history, encountering ancient civilizations, exploring long-forgotten ruins, and unearthing ancient mysteries that have slept undisturbed for ages.

Pokémon Epoch Version will focus on the theme of time and how the past, present, and future are irrevocably intertwined. The story will delve into the importance of maintaining tradition while embracing progress and change.

Pokémon Eon Version, on the other hand, will see trainers starting their adventure with the powerful Tsabarite at their side. As they travel through the world, players will be tasked with guiding humanity’s desires towards a more virtuous path. Along the way, they will need to unite people and Pokémon from all walks of life, building bridges and fostering greater understanding between different cultures and generations.

Pokémon Eon Version explores the theme of desire; how it affects our lives, shapes our choices, and influences our future. The story will examine the multitude of desires that guide humanity, highlighting the need for love, goodwill, and cooperation to steer desires towards positive and fulfilling outcomes.

For both versions, the central plot revolves around the mysterious Twilight Zone, where an ancient prophecy foretells the awakening of Proklinachi and Tsabarite, who hold the key to shaping humanity’s destiny. As strife rises in the Glaciwild Region, players must uncover the true meaning behind the prophecy and find a way to prevent the potentially catastrophic consequences that loom on the horizon.

Throughout their adventures, players will forge alliances not only with Proklinachi and Tsabarite but also with other powerful and enigmatic Pokémon. They will need to work together to uncover the truth behind ancient legends and resolve the conflict that threatens the delicate balance of the world.

Ultimately, players will face a choice that could alter the course of the Glaciwild Region forever. Will they strive for timeless wisdom and unity with Proklinachi in Pokémon Epoch Version, or pursue an eternal bond of hope and prosperity with Tsabarite in Pokémon Eon Version? The fate of the world rests in the hands of our intrepid trainers as they embrace the essence of time, desire, and destiny itself.

            const scrollSection = document.querySelector(".scroll-section");

            let handlingScroll = false;

            function normalizeDelta(delta) {
                return Math.sign(delta);
            }

            function getClosestAnchorDirection() {
                const scrollOffset = scrollSection.scrollTop;
                const windowHeight = scrollSection.clientHeight;

                let nextAnchorDistance = null;
                let anchorOffset = null;
                let signOfAnchor = null;
                anchors.forEach((anchor) => {
                    anchorOffset = anchor.offsetTop;

                    let distanceToAnchor = Math.abs(
                        anchorOffset - scrollOffset
                    );
                    if (nextAnchorDistance == null) {
                        nextAnchorDistance = distanceToAnchor;
                        signOfAnchor = normalizeDelta(
                                anchorOffset - scrollOffset
                            );
                    } else if (distanceToAnchor < nextAnchorDistance) {
                        nextAnchorDistance = distanceToAnchor;
                        signOfAnchor = normalizeDelta(
                                anchorOffset - scrollOffset
                            );
                    }
                });
                return signOfAnchor;
            }

            function getAnchorInDirection(delta) {
                const scrollOffset = scrollSection.scrollTop;
                const windowHeight = scrollSection.clientHeight;

                let nextAnchor = null;
                let nextAnchorOffset = null;
                let anchorOffset = null;

                anchors.forEach((anchor) => {

                    if (

                                const fraction = elapsed / scrollDuration;

                                if (fraction < 1) {
                                    const easeOut = braking
                                        ? -Math.pow(2, -10 * fraction) + 1
                                        : fraction;
                                    scrollToAnchor(
                                        start + (offset - start) * easeOut
                                    );

                                    requestAnimationFrame(tick);
                                } else {
                                    scrollToAnchor(offset);
                                    endTick = true;
                                    requestAnimationFrame(tick);
                                }
                            }
                        }
                    }
                };
                //console.log("requestAnimationFrame");
                requestAnimationFrame(tick);
            }

            function scrollCloseToAnchor(
                offset,
                distance,
                braking,
                callback = null
            ) {
                if (offset == scrollSection.scrollTop) {
                    //console.log("scrolling = false");
                    scrolling = false;
                    handlingScroll = false;
                    oldScroll = scrollSection.scrollTop;
                    cancelScroll = false;
                    console.log(
                        "doğmadan öldüm ben",
                        offset,
                        scrollSection.scrollTop
                    );
                    return;
                }
                console.log("scroll to anchor anim başladı");
                offset = Math.round(offset);
                distance = Math.round(distance);
                const start = scrollSection.scrollTop;
                const startTime = performance.now();
                //console.log(offset, distance);
                const scrollDuration = braking ? distance * 10 : distance * 2;
                let difference = Math.abs(scrollSection.scrollTop - offset);
                const tick = (now) => {
                    if (cancelScroll) {
                        console.log("animasyon iptal");
                        lastDirection = 0;
                        cancelScroll = false;
                    } else {
                        console.log("scroll to anchor anim devam ediyor");
                        if (
                            Math.abs(scrollSection.scrollTop - offset) >
                            difference
                        ) {
                            //scrolling = false;
                            //handlingScroll = false;
                            //oldScroll = window.scrollY;
                            console.log("Baba error, uzaklaştı");
                            difference = Math.abs(
                                scrollSection.scrollTop - offset
                            );
                            requestAnimationFrame(tick);
                        } else {
                            difference = Math.abs(
                                scrollSection.scrollTop - offset
                            );

                            const elapsed = now - startTime;
                            const fraction = elapsed / scrollDuration;
                            //console.log(elapsed, fraction);
                            if (fraction < 1) {
                                const easeOut = braking
                                    ? -Math.pow(2, -10 * fraction) + 1
                                    : fraction;

                                scrollToAnchor(
                                    start + (offset - start) * easeOut
                                );

                                requestAnimationFrame(tick);
                            } else {
                                if (callback !== null) callback();
                                scrollToAnchor(offset);
                            }
                        }
                    }
                };
                //console.log("requestAnimationFrame");
                requestAnimationFrame(tick);
            }
        </script>
    </body>
</html>

@Component
@ConditionalOnProperty(name = "baselinker.schedulers.stocks.enabled", havingValue = "true", matchIfMissing = true)
public class BaselinkerStocksScheduler {

  private static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(BaselinkerStocksScheduler.class);
  APIGatewayBaselinker apiGatewayBaselinker;
  StocksServiceInterface databaseService;
  DatabaseStocks mongoDbBaselinkerStocks;
  FtpServicePromoStocks ftpServicePromoStocks;
  @Value("${baselinker.inventory.faina-offprice}")
  private String INVENTORY_FAINA_OFFPRICE;
  @Value("${baselinker.inventory.faina-panda}")
  private String INVENTORY_PANDA;
  @Value("${baselinker.warehouse.id}")
  private String WAREHOUSE_ID;


  public BaselinkerStocksScheduler(APIGatewayBaselinker apiGatewayBaselinker,
      FtpServicePromoStocks ftpServicePromoStocks, DatabaseStocks mongoDbBaselinkerStocks) {
    this.apiGatewayBaselinker = apiGatewayBaselinker;
    this.ftpServicePromoStocks = ftpServicePromoStocks;
    this.mongoDbBaselinkerStocks = mongoDbBaselinkerStocks;
    this.databaseService = new StocksService(mongoDbBaselinkerStocks,
        new BaseLinkerJsonToBaseLinkerNosqlStocks());
  }

  private ProductsJson deserializeResponse(HttpResponse<ProductsJson> response) throws IOException {
    ProductsJson productsJson;
    try (DataInputStream inputStream = new DataInputStream(
        new CharSequenceInputStream((CharSequence) response.body(), "UTF-8"))) {
      productsJson = (ProductsJson) ObjectsDeserializer.load(inputStream, ProductsJson.class);
    }
    return productsJson;
  }

  @Scheduled(initialDelay = 100 * 20, fixedDelay = Long.MAX_VALUE)
  public void startup()
      throws ServiceOperationException, IOException {
    log.debug("Cleaning folder directory on startup");
    FileHelper.clearAllDirectory(FILES.STOCK_DIRECTORY);
    stocksDiffLoader();
  }

  private void loadInventoryToDatabase(String inventoryId, ProductsJson productsJson)
      throws DatabaseOperationException, ParseException, ServiceOperationException {
    databaseService.loadInventory(inventoryId, productsJson);
  }

  private ProductsJson loadInventoryFromApi(String inventoryId)
      throws DatabaseOperationException, ParseException, ServiceOperationException, IOException, InterruptedException {
    boolean isProductListEmpty = false;
    Map<String, ProductJson> appendedProductList = new HashMap<>();
    int page = 1;
    while (!isProductListEmpty) {
      EnumMap<RequestParameters, String> mapRequest = new EnumMap<>(RequestParameters.class);
      mapRequest.put(RequestParameters.inventory_id, inventoryId);
      mapRequest.put(RequestParameters.page, String.valueOf(page++));
      Optional<ProductsJson> inventoryFromApi = Optional.ofNullable(deserializeResponse(
          apiGatewayBaselinker.stockQuery(RequestMethod.getInventoryProductsList, mapRequest)));
      if (inventoryFromApi.isPresent()) {
        if (inventoryFromApi.get().getProducts() == null || inventoryFromApi.get().getProducts()
            .isEmpty()) {
          isProductListEmpty = true;
        } else {
          appendedProductList.putAll(inventoryFromApi.get().getProducts());
        }
      } else {
        break;
      }
    }
    return ProductsJson.builder().products(appendedProductList).build();
  }

  @Scheduled(cron = "${baselinker.schedulers.inventory.cron}", zone = "Europe/Warsaw")
  @SchedulerLock(name = "inventoryLoader", lockAtLeastFor = "${baselinker.scheduler.lockMinimalTime.INVENTORY}", lockAtMostFor = "${scheduler.lockMaxTime.INVENTORY}")
  public void inventoryLoader() {
    try {
      ProductsJson loadedInventoryFainaOffPrice = loadInventoryFromApi(INVENTORY_FAINA_OFFPRICE);
      loadInventoryToDatabase(INVENTORY_FAINA_OFFPRICE, loadedInventoryFainaOffPrice);
      log.info("Successfully loaded faina offprice inventory");
      ProductsJson loadedInventoryPanda = loadInventoryFromApi(INVENTORY_PANDA);
      loadInventoryToDatabase(INVENTORY_PANDA, loadedInventoryPanda);
      log.info("Successfully loaded panda inventory");
    } catch (IOException | ServiceOperationException | InterruptedException |

      Map<String, Integer> inventoryStocksDiffCsvPromo = new HashMap<>();
      ftpServicePromoStocks.getStocks("bestand_diff", "stock_diff.csv", Duration.ofHours(2L));

          Paths.get(FILES.STOCK_DIRECTORY, "stock_diff.csv").toString(),
          inventoryStocksDiffCsvPromo,
          (key, value) -> key, Integer::parseInt);
      Map<Set<String>, Integer> mapProductIdStocksForFainaOffPriceInventory = databaseService.updateStocksInDatabaseReturnHashmapProductIdAndStocks(
          INVENTORY_FAINA_OFFPRICE, inventoryStocksDiffCsvPromo);
      Map<Set<String>, Integer> mapProductIdStocksForPandaInventory = databaseService.updateStocksInDatabaseReturnHashmapProductIdAndStocks(
          INVENTORY_PANDA, inventoryStocksDiffCsvPromo);
      if(mapProductIdStocksForFainaOffPriceInventory == null || mapProductIdStocksForFainaOffPriceInventory.isEmpty()) {
        log.info("No changes in stocks for faina offprice inventory");
      }
      else {
        apiGatewayBaselinker.stockUpdateQuery(INVENTORY_FAINA_OFFPRICE, WAREHOUSE_ID,
            mapProductIdStocksForFainaOffPriceInventory);
      }
      if(mapProductIdStocksForPandaInventory == null || mapProductIdStocksForPandaInventory.isEmpty()) {
        log.info("No changes in stocks for panda inventory");
      }
      else {
        apiGatewayBaselinker.stockUpdateQuery(INVENTORY_PANDA, WAREHOUSE_ID,
            mapProductIdStocksForPandaInventory);

        log.error("Error Fatal: {}", e.getCause());

    }

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <title><%= musician.name %> - Musician Profile</title>
    <!-- Bootstrap CSS -->
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://maxcdn.bootstrapcdn.com/bootstrap/4.5.2/css/bootstrap.min.css">
    <!-- jQuery -->
    <script src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.5.1/jquery.min.js"></script>
    <!-- Popper.js -->
    <script src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/popper.js/1.16.0/umd/popper.min.js"></script>
    <!-- Bootstrap JS -->
    <script src="https://maxcdn.bootstrapcdn.com/bootstrap/4.5.2/js/bootstrap.min.js"></script>
    <!-- jQuery UI CSS -->
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="/jquery-ui/themes/base/all.css" />
    <!-- Custom CSS -->
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="/css/main.css" />
    <!-- jQuery UI JS -->
    <script src="/jquery-ui/dist/jquery-ui.min.js"></script>
	<script src="/jquery/dist/jquery.min.js"></script>

  </head>
  <body>
    <div class="container">
      <div class="row">
        <div class="col-md-3">
          <img src="/img/<%= musician.thumbnail || 'avatar.jpg' %>" alt="<%= musician.name %>" width="200" height="200">
        </div>
        <div class="col-md-8">
          <h1><%= musician.name %></h1>
          <p><strong>Role:</strong> <%= musician.role %></p>
          <p><strong>Genre:</strong> <%= musician.genre %></p>
          <% if (musician.role === 'Artist' && musician.instrument) { %>
            <p><strong>Instrument:</strong> <%= musician.instrument %></p>
          <% } %>
          <p><strong>Location:</strong> <%= musician.city %></p>
          <p><strong>Bio:</strong> <%= musician.bio %></p>
          <% if (musician.soundcloud) { %>
            <div class="embed-responsive embed-responsive-16by9">

                          <option value="Artist" <%= musician.role === 'Artist' ? 'selected' : '' %>>Artist</option>
                        </select>
                      </div>
                      <div class="form-group">
